body: Do you really have a `/vendor` root folder on your computer?

Ditto ☝️ Your app is looking for them in a `/vendor` folder on your computer and not somewhere within the project. They also don't seem to be in the project.

This looks to be an issue of using the correct path. 

> How do i reference the vendor files in my index.html file?

You can reference them as is typical in HTML with `<script src=""></script>` but you can also use Node requires as is done in the Electron API Demos app https://github.com/electron/electron-api-demos/blob/master/index.html#L103.

@jdell64 I would try to follow a tutorial specifically geared toward Electron, I think that `ng new` is assuming it's being hosted over HTTP and is trying to use protocol-relative URLs  (i.e. `//foo/bar/`)

So, I've prepeneded it with

```
__dirname +
```

in a require function as well, and it gets passed those four, but then
inside @angular, that tries to call a different file...

I've looked at a number of tutorials with angular2+electron, and they all
package assets differently. Some preface anything with localhost and just
have node running at the same time, others do all sorts of minifying, but
all of them were published months ago (which in JavaScript time is like
millennia). Since most of these, angular2 was renamed and a number of
packages have changed.

Sorry for bugging you. I know this isn't really a bug, I've just been
working on this for 2 days now with no results. And yes, I am very new at
this.
